import Popover from '@wedgekit/popover';
import Button from '@wedgekit/button';

import TabbedComponentViewer from '../../../src/components/TabbedComponentViewer';

# Popover

A common form element, a popover is a non-modal dialog used to display additional information to the user. The popover shares focus, and can include a clickable element.

export const Test = () => {
  const [open, setOpen] = React.useState(false);
  const ref = React.useRef();
  return (
    <div>
      <TabbedComponentViewer tabs={['popover']}>
        <Button ref={ref} onClick={() => setOpen(true)}>
          Open Popover
        </Button>
      </TabbedComponentViewer>
      {open && (
        <Popover node={ref.current} onExit={() => setOpen(false)}>
          <div
            style={{
              padding: '24px',
              backgroundColor: 'white',
              fontSize: '16px',
              'border-radius': '4px',
            }}
          >
            Here is some content.
          </div>
        </Popover>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

<Test />
